2022 Having put 200 hours in this game, reaching the soft cap in almost every attribute, having collected all legendary armaments, talismans, and spirit ashes, I can say for certain that this is one of the greatest games I have ever played and possibly will ever play in my life. This game is for die hard soulsborne fans and newcomers to the series alike. (and yes, this is a souls game I don't care what any elitist fan has to say.) The world of Elden Ring is a world filled with grandiose beauty, mystery around every corner, and a lore with a depth so unfathomable and secretive it at times shook me to my very core. The combat is so well done and polished, the weapon and armor designs were badass, and the character customization is the best it has ever been in a from software game. For newcomers, they have added the ability to fast travel to various spots on the absolutely daunting world map. While riding Torrent, your mount, you will experience some of the best mounted combat which had echos of legendary open world title Shadow of the Colossus and the final boss of Twilight Princess on Epona. Now, onto the difficulty. I know this has been a topic of debate among fans but I will give you my honest opinion having sunk hundreds of hours into the soulsborne titles: this is the most difficult soulsborne game to date and has undoubtedly two of the hardest boss battles I have ever faced in my 25 years of gaming. The gratification gained for sticking it to some of the bosses in this game was immense and full of a mix of overwhelming emotions. With all this being said, please, pick up this game, believe the hype, it is a masterwork for Miyazaki and the From Software team.

2023 I put 420 hours into Total Warhammer 2. 20 hours into Total Warhammer 3 desperately trying to recapture the fun.TW games are always going to be a money and time pit - thats just fine if you to get a lot out of it. 2022 Warhammer 3 like, Warhammer 2 - has some issues at launch; but no core problems which would make me it declare it dead on arrival like many AAA games these past few years. The major inconveniences I've experienced until now are minor stutters, odd UI elements and units in battle looking like they are in a mosh pit and not really attacking each other. I see these mostly as minor issues, bugs - which will eventually be ironed out and fixed by Creative Assembly. For the rest, like UI being too red (which I have no problem with), there will be mods to take care of them. To put it simply, this is a positive recommendation from me, simply because I feel that the game oozes with personality, care and charm - the animations are great, fun, the combat is a blast to look at, the new maps are great and it feels like overall a great deal of effort was put into making new interesting mechanics. One issue I've had until now, is that without the huge amount of unit variety from Warhammer 2 (especially towards the end) the game feels a bit lacking; but I 100% expect both more free units to come over time paired alongside paid DLC. In the past CA has shown a great deal of care towards Warhammer games, I see no reason why they would stop now.

Imagine a game where you’re a human struggling to survive in a world so hostile it makes a toddler’s tantrum look like a walk in the park. Welcome to Once Human, where the phrase “tough but fair” is replaced by “tough and absolutely unfair.”From the moment you start, it’s clear this game hates you with the intensity of a thousand suns. Want to explore? Great! You’ll be met with hostile creatures that seem to have taken a few tips from “How to Ruin Your Day 101.” Every step feels like a bad idea, and your character’s life expectancy is measured in milliseconds.The graphics are stunning, but so is the sheer terror of knowing that every shadow could be the last thing you see. Combat is a thrilling mix of “I hope I don’t die” and “I’m definitely going to die.” And the storyline? It’s like a Kafka novel but with more zombies and less existential dread.In short, Once Human is perfect for anyone who thinks their life isn’t stressful enough and could use a little digital despair. If you’re looking for a game to help you question your existence and enjoy a hearty laugh at your own misfortune, this is it.

2022 My review will remain negative despite a lot of good will being generated by Thrones of Decay.They're making a lot of great steps; individually purchaseable legendary lords, more content in the DLC than Shadows released and more exciting units as well, they brought back a FLC lord release for the expansion, faction reworks are back and for all 3 of the headline races as well. There's a lot of good stuff I like seeing here, but despite that I have to remind people, CA has apologized for the state of Warhammer 3 like three or four times since its release. Every step forward is two steps back for them. When I see them carry forward the consumer friendly choices they've rolled out for Thrones of Decay into the next DLC as well then I will change my review to a recommend. Don't forget, for every "Champions of Chaos" they release they tend to follow it up with a "Shadows of Change" and "complaints are a privilege not a right" controversy on their forums.This is an edited review: in quotes below was my previous review, made during the height of the Shadows of Change controversy and poor reception."I put 800 hours into this game during its broken release and the year and half that followed where it was still broken.I love Total war warhammer, and stuck with it through what I thought was its lowest point. Unfortunately its still not over.The DLC pricing model is atrocious, even THEN I was on the fence about getting "Shadows of Change" but then they addressed the price hike and threatened/disrespected their playerbase. CA has finally lost deep veterans like me who have put in 2k-3k+ hours across the series. I won't be getting any more DLC's or putting in any more play hours into this game until CA publicly acknowledges its failings, apologizes, and changes its pricing.And based on what I'm seeing, I'm very much not alone."

2013 I slowly look at the luminescent green dial of my wristwatch, which tells me it is 5:46, am. Damn.Another night of Insomnia. I sit up in my bed, and listen to the soft hum of my Radeon™ HD 7870 GHz Edition, as her fans slowly cool the surface of her brilliant silicon plates. The only light in this room comes from the electric blue glow of my keyboard, and the azure LEDs in my Razer Abyssus.I press a button, and the display of a 23 inch, 1080p IPS monitor lights up, colors shifting and changing in psychedelic pattens, chromatic waves of light bluring and stabilizing to send an image within my mind. My desktop stares back at me; the only icon the Recycle bin. I move my eyes to the Taskbar, where the icons for Windows Explorer, Star Citizen, Mozilla Firefox, and lastly Steam return my gaze.I click on Steam, and watch as a loading bar appears. The light from the moniter shines brilliantly on my face, and if I look closely into it, I can see myself reflected in the crystal surface, eyes staring deep into a mad realm of pixels and insomnia.Steam finally loads. Oh, what's this? There's a sale on? Ah, too bad; I only have one cent in my wallet. I click the library tab in a futile attempt to find meaning.My list of games appears, showing me hints of open doors into new worlds, strange and wonderful. What path sould I choose? Should I join battle with Dragons, in the strage land of the Nords? Or, perhaps, I should launch the StarCitizen hangar module, and lust after a dream of flight, a game not yet finished.Ah, but here it is; Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. How many hours have I thus spent within you, oh CS:GO? You have been the reason for many nights without sleep, many days of ragequits, many days of fun and sadness. I pull out a calculator from somewhere on my desk: dividing one thousand, eight hundred and eighty-five hours by twenty-four tells me that I've been within this game for seventy-eight point five days so far. Damn.The game begins loading, and I hear the soft hum of GPU fans, and the silent sound of the sunrise, far beyond the single window of my room._Ah, where was I? I guess I feel alseep for a second there. Skip the intros, enter main menu, searc- Wait, what? 20 friends online? But, it's like 6 am... Oh, right, timezones. Eh, I might as well invite all these people.Well, I guess I didn't want to play with them anyway. Green light fills my room, I press accept, and wait for the ninth player. Who, it seems, never can figure out what the big glowing green button actually means. Oh well, it just found another match anyway.Well, third time's the chram, right? I guess not. Fourth time does it, and we're away. Cue loading screen, begin meaningless text I've seen only a few thousand times before.I get up, walk towards the kitchen, and only trip twice on miscellaneous paraphernalia in the dark hallways. The bleak windows of the room greet me: pale dawn, gray clouds and black trees visible through their panes. The neon numerals of the microwave tell the time as 6:07. I search the pantry and refr!gerator, but find nothing of value.I lower my standards and try again, this time coming up with a few tastless cookies of some kind. I begin a pilgrimage to whence I came.The last stars of night grow cold and die; as color once again spreads over the sky. Monitor glow, winter snow, cybernetic flow.My quest now complete, with prize in hand, I return to my chair. 0's and 1's stream across a fiberoptic gulf of space, connecting people hundreds of miles apart in a beautiful lattice of data, all for my enjoyment. I begin the first round, and purchase a FN Five-Seven and a Flashbang grenade.I move over to long A, and hold my sights on the old wooden doors. An insurgent sprints through the open door, firing his Glock-18 as fast as he can, his bullets hitting the wal beside my head.I pull the trigger, a volcanic plume of hot gas propelling a one gram lead alloy projectile at twice the speed of sound into the side of his head; The FN 5.7×28mm armor piercing round delivering a fatal 540 Joules of energy. The neon Stattrak™ display mounted on the left side of my Case Hardened Five-Seven increases by one, and a bright flare from the muzzle reflects its light in the cold metal of a name tag, the words "NOT ON MY WATCH" silently mocking those fools who fall by my pistol, in an absurd pun about clocks.Another Terrorist moves into view, I fire three supersonic rounds into his chest, and one in his skull. Again the neon numbers shift and rearrange in a mad dance, as bullets enter my manly chest hair and are absorbed.A third Terrorist fires, and I die in the gameworld, madly shooting as my bullets hit empty space. Pixels shift and change in an algorithmic song, and my teammates finish what I began, with the severing of a red wire a small number one is added in blue to the top of my screen.Second round, man. Time to roll. I got long- wait, why are two of you going there? Nevermind, I'll hold Catwalk._Turns out they decided to rush Mid with pistols. Poor choice. I leap out of catwalk into mid as they rush the doors, electric blue pathways of fire traversing the void between my tazer and and the insurgent's back. He screams in death as I drop the now-useless tazer and unholster a Bizon SMG; 9mm rounds begining to sputter at 320 meters per second into the backs of my foes as a Terrorist pulls a 180 and flicks a round into my skull with his CZ-75 Automatic, punching through my helmet into the flesh beneath. I mutter to myself "I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hate that gun" while typing out "#TAZED ♥♥♥♥♥" in all chat.Childish insults fly like eagles, soaring over skies of wire and valleys of silicon to majestically land in the lower right of my vision, proclaiming their wondrous messages for all to see. "get rekt" "u suck" "TIME to die, amirite"Using the mighty power of a pistol save round, the enemy gains a round.From far beyond my drywall cube, a sun the color of a Helium discharge tube bleeds the first light of Autumn into a sky the color of Krypton: but here I am safe from its incandescent fingers, here, the persistance of color exists in the 60hz of my monitor. Perhaps tomorrow will be different? Oh, but I don't think it will.The scoreboard moves with its own hateful volition, seemingly granting rounds with a heart of cinder and magma. Chaos lies within its eyes.Final round of the first half begins and I press f1 to auto buy, supplanting my XM1014 from the previous round with an M4A4 Bullet Rain, tastefully decorated with a "REKT" holographic sticker and renamed "Clockwork ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥". I once again reflect on what a stupid name that is, and regret selling my Desert Eagle Blaze to buy it.Surprisingly, my team manages to hold a push at long. In the simultaneous push to cat a rain of lead from a thundering sky finds my face with magnetic precision, and in the downtime I skim through my Ebook library on my phone. I've been considering writing something in the style of Neuromancer or Ready Player One for awhile now, perhaps if I can find the right subject... Oh well, that's a project for another day. Translation: never.Halftime, and the tally stands at ten for them and five for us. I've seen worse. I've seen better too, but what the hell, this isn't hopeless yet.Pistol round begins and I buy Dualies, partly just to ♥♥♥♥ with people and partly because for reasons that I can neither explain nor defend I'm ridiculously good with them. Don't dis my Dualie skills, man. Just accept it. Like a wizard and his wand: you do not choose the Dualies, the Dualies choose you.I pop smoke Mid and rush Catwalk, suddenly realizing I hit the character limit while subsequently breaking the 4th wall.I slowly look at the luminescent green dial of my wristwatch, which tells me it is 6:34, am. Damn.Another night of Insomnia.

2022 I finished my first campaign today in WH3. For context, I did about 50 turns in my first campaign (Kislev, normal/normal) just to get a feel for the game, then went all in on my second run (Kislev again, legendary/easy). Wow...let me just say that without a doubt, this was the best campaign I've ever played in a Total War game. I've played most of them from the first Shogun all the way to WH1 and 2, and this was easily the best. Not a single dull moment, no feeling of that late game grind, the feel and atmosphere and mechanics were just phenomenal. Overall, amazing campaign, amazing game. Perfect? No...but still absolutely awesome. I really wish I could experience this campaign as all the factions, but we'll just have to see how mortal empires turns out.

2023 The game would be awesome, but:- it's full of bugs (choke-full)- the powercreep has climbed over the roof and started building a rocket to reach the moon- the game designers seem to have lost touch with what made the Total War series fun: it has really questionable balancing and some very poor design choices- CA's strategy seem to be pumping out pricy DLCs with awesome art direction to wow the possible customers, but then deliver an unbalanced mess that breaks the game in some way or another- the game is unbearably easy. If you like seeing monsters smashing on each other, you may find it entertaining for a few hours; if you are looking for interesting choices, a challenging AI, and a good game experience, you'll be disappointed- the AI is somehow worse than in game 2, both in battle and campaignI have played the game a lot, modded it to try and make it make sense, but finally I gave up: it can't be saved, because CA cares more about short term profit margins than providing a good game. Every DLC is a pre-order marketing fest that never fails to disappoint.Sadly, I don't recommend it.

It's completely filled to the brim with cheaters. - VAC is the worst anti-cheat in existence. Valve takes HWID of users however, they will not ban based on HWID. They only ban by account so the hacker can just make a new one and do it all over again.- Valve is making a huge profit off NOT banning hackers. When a hacker gets their account banned, they just get another one and purchase prime ($15). Valve clearly sees this as a revenue source and will never actually take any real action against cheaters. - There is a secondary market for leveling fresh accounts to premiere and selling them, people use inexpensive hacks to level accounts and then re-sell them for more - People are running automated AI-based bots that can dupe weapons and automatically cheat same as in TF2 - Premiere game mode is completely off balance. Once you reach 10k+ ELO your matches will only net you ~50-100 ELO and you will lose between ~300-1000 every game. Complete timesink.- Valve's "subtick" is garbage. The game will always have peeker's advantage - if you have a high ping around around 50ms-100ms you will always have that much more time to see someone on your screen before they will see you- Public "find a group" feature is filled with Russians posing as "professional" players who invite you to lobbies, try to get you into a discord channel and then socially engineer you to "signup for their team" which is a steam account phishing page.Game is still fun and a classic - but is clearly still in an alpha development stage. Valve trying to claim or boast that CS2 is a "competitive" shooter is completely invalid. Any "competitive" teams are phony. Faceit, ESEA and competitive game modes all filled with blatant cheaters. You could dump years of time into this game trying to "git gud" but you will never beat the script kiddies let alone be able to keep up with the constant updates to the game mechanics.I highly encourage everyone to play this game on competitive/premiere mode and treat it as if completely casual, because it is.

2015 Well hi and thanks for stopping by.After over 1000 hours of gameplay and reaching the LEM rank i consider myself expierenced player of CS:GO.If you are thinking about buying this game, you might find this review helpfull.What to start with... ? Surely if you are looking for highly competetive game, this is for you. You can compete with other players, and unlike in for example MOBA games, winning 1v5 is always an option. Beacouse this is the game where your personal skill matters.But thats not the most important thing. This game teaches you teamwork, of course if you are Scream's son you can just solo win every round, but its not the goal of the game. If you solo que in competetive, you will be put in a random game with 4 random people on your team, and 5 random people in the enemy team. They can be different nationaliy, have different characters and react to things differently. But for the time of the game, 4 of your teammates are you best friends. You are supposed to watch their back, coordinate tactics to execute best situations for winning a round and communicate as much as possible.Of course you can have a bad day, and meet 4 people that will not speak your language, will have a bad day as well and will try to grief you and loose the game on purpose. But thats just a rare percentage of my personal experience. You need to always stay positive and calm, and so will your team do.When it comes to game mechanics. CS:GO isnt very complicated, but its very original compared to other FPS games. You are aiming your crosshair at a guy, holding that left mouse button like there is no tomorrow, but you are still not hitting ? Try chilling out a bit and just tapping that mouse. Dont run when you shoot, stop, aim up, fire. Its the way to go in CS. You will get frustrated a lot, you will curse, throw your screen out of your window, but dont worry: When you master the game, there is no better feeling than headshoting an awper with a deagle, trust me.I mentioned a deagle... but there is a high variety of weapons in this game. Pistoles different for certain situations. Shotguns, SMGs, Rifles. You can even have your own Light Machine Gun ! But choose the negev, since m249 is worthless. Always felt MLG quickscope power in your veins ? Buy an AWP and the power of one shot kill (Unless you hit in the legs). Or if you are poor, just buy yourself a SSG08 and go for those tasty headshots. But to be completely honest, gun you will need to master at the first place will be AK47. If you managed to learn the spray pattern, the long range potential and the power of one shot headshot (To compare, no other rifle has that power... well except the negev and the deagle, but those are not guns you will mainly play) you should be good to go to play competetive.Competetive ? But are there any other game modes ? Yes of course. You have very old and popular arms race, where everyone shoot each other to level up the guns and in the end kill someone with a golden knife. You get the demolition. Something like competetive, but you are not allowed to buy guns, you level them up instead every round, if you get a kill. We have a deatchmatch where you can practice and warm up (And I reccomend starting the game with this), you also get the most famous :Casual. Full of unranked, new players, sometimes bored globals, but mostly people playing cs:go for fun, not for rank.Are there any other gamemodes ? This seems boring. Of course there are plenty of community servers allowing you to play Battle Royale, Deathruns, Bhop servers, Surfs, Hide n Seek, Zombie modes and A LOT other cool stuff that myself havent managed to discover yet.But wait, if the game seems that cool, there must be a catch to this. And yes there is. If you dont know russian... oh poor soul, wish you luck, since you will be yelled at a lot. You can also meet cheaters, obvious ones that just spinbot around killing you through 10 walls to boost the rank of some noob paying for it, or you can meet trying to boost themselfes with a slight aim assistance or bhop scripts, but its barely noticable. I rarely meet cheaters, and regulary fulfill my duty as part of the Overwatch.Overwatch ? What is this ? Its a system implemented in the game allowing you as a player to watch a demo of a game, where somebody got reported. And the person that got reported is the POV you will see. Its completely anonymus, but also helps catching people that somehow avoid the VAC system. But dont think you will get access to it easily, takes some time.Last thing i wanted to mention are... skins. And ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ this like csgo has its own economy. For money you buy keys, for keys you trade skins, for skins you get skins. Since if you have skins, you must be a pro player, right ? Thats silly, but some of the skins used in game cost over 10k $ and its not a joke. You can loose money opening cases, you can get yourself this kinky knife skin you always wanted. But dont get addicted to it, since me myself spent way more money on the skins than I wanted. Well... what can I say10/10Looking forward to playing more.

I have been gaming for a couple of decades now and SM2 was like a breath of fresh air. It was like putting on an old, comfy, warm, sweater. It had that nostalgic feeling from back in the long-long ago when games were about fun and not a political litmus test. It brought back the feeling of enjoyment, before every game became open world and had linear skill progression trees pretending to be "role playing". It brought back the joy of earning things from playing. It didn't suck. And after the huge piles of triple "A" suck that have been shoveled down our throats for ages now...it nice to actually enjoy something again.Being a huge WH40k fan on the side helped for sure, but SM2 is the best experience in gaming I have had in a long, long time.

I got a thing going here.Mom: Ah, you got some lint on your fuzz.Barry: Ow! That's me!Dad: Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.Barry: Bye! (flies off)Mom: Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house! (Barry drives his car to pick up his classmate. Adam's outside his house, reading the Hive Today newspaper. The front page headline reads "FRISBEE HITS HIVE ! Internet Down. I'm glad I took off one day in the middle and just hitchhiked around the hive.Adam: You did come back different. Looks good.Adam: Hey, did you hear about Frankie?Barry: Yeah.Adam: You goin' to his funeral?Barry: No, I'm not goin' to his funeral. Everybody knows you sting someone, you die. "In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war"From the moment you step into your power armor, you’re no longer just a human, you’re a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ walking cathedral of destruction, blessed by the Emperor’s divine will. Xenos? Heretics? Chaos-worshipping filth? They’re not your enemies, they’re your next target practice. Reload, deliver, and repeat until the galaxy is cleansed. The Combat It’s pure, undiluted rage made flesh. You don’t just kill your enemies, you annihilate them with every pull of the trigger, as if the Emperor himself is screaming “Purge harder!” in your ears! The Story It's simple, if it’s not human, it dies. You don’t need context or a reason; they’re xenos, they exist, that’s enough to condemn them. You are the Emperor’s fist, and the galaxy is your punching bag. Pros: Combat: Feels like the Emperor is constantly high-fiving you with each alien head you pop. Graphics: The gothic aesthetic is so good that it might just convert you into the Ecclesiarchy. Seriously, there are more skulls here than a Necron fashion show. Immersion: It’s as Warhammer as it gets. Every word, every bolt round, every alien screams, “This is for the Emperor!” Soundtrack: Epic, orchestral score that makes every fight feel like a holy war. The game might just double your manliness thanks to its intense, testosterone-fueled action Cons: The keybindings might feel like they were designed by a heretic, but fear not. adjust them, and your controls will be as precise as a Space Marine's aim Some minor bugs and crashes, but honestly, that’s probably just Nurgle trying to mess with your game. Purge your system, brother. Tyranids don't scream enough when you smash 'em. Could use more screaming.9/10 – Would obliterate xenos and heretics again while screaming ‘FOR THE EMPEROR!’

2022 This is one of my favorite games I have ever played, it has grabbed my attention and held it with an iron grip. Anytime I figure out what I wanna do, it's very hard to resist the siren call of ELDEN RING.The exploration in this game is absolutely a treat, it really feels like discoveries can be made in every little nook and cranny. With some boldness and knowledge of how far you can fall without dying, there are very few places you can't get to, and usually will be rewarded for taking the time to explore it all.The combat is extremely polished, every playstyle is viable and can have a ton of fun variety within those styles. Most enemies and bosses are incredibly awesome to just LOOK at, let alone actually fight and overcome. Not all of them can be winners, but with the sheer volume and variety already on display, I believe that's fully excusable. From the replayability and ridiculous amount of content here, I believe that anyone who isn't afraid of some level of difficulty should give this a shot and be delighted by what it offers.

2022 I like FROM's games and in my opinion this is their best game yet. It has open world dungeons and locations to explore, but it also has "levels" that are the bottleneck for opening up the next part of the story or area which feels very souls-esque and is what keeps the flow very varied.I've been to a particular place 3 times and never came across "the chest" people talk about, nor did I encounter the enemy there that everyone talks about, but I did find a chest that most people miss. It's kind of wild how different people can go to the same area and have totally different experiences or miss certain things. The game is very generous with its "bonfires" aka sites of grace, which was surprising to me.The difficulty is still there and if you aren't feeling like it is for the first chapter it will start presenting itself in later chapters for most players. Your health stats are more important than ever this time around. If you don't have a good 20 to 30 points into Vigor you'll get one-shot by a lot of stuff, so keep that in mind!TIP: If you aren't sure about a boss yet and you don't want to cross the fog unwittingly, just put your summon sign down and help people as many times as you want to learn the boss patterns and even get free souls/items along the way!!! No shame!If you like Dark Souls in any way or if you want a brutal fantasy adventure, yes I recommend this. ((There's currently some tech issues that they know about and are addressing, so if your PC isn't exceeding their specs you might want to wait a moment or just be aware you'll have to turn down your settings.))

2022 Elden Ring is the latest game developed by FromSoftware, a company well-known for its Souls franchise. This time, FromSoftware took a departure from its standard linear/semi-open world approach to its game development. Instead, it opted for an open-world approach, with heavy reliance on Souls’ game mechanics. After I learned that Elden Ring would be developed as an open-world Souls game, I was worried about how the game would turn out. However, Elden Ring turned out to be something far better than I had imagined.Pros:- A vast world filled with activities, secrets, sidequests, enemies, and bosses that will entertain players for hundreds of hours- A wonderful sense of exploration that is unparalleled in its scope and design- Boss battles that are difficult yet extremely satisfying - Beautiful graphics that show noticeable improvements over older titles, such as Dark Souls 3 and Sekiro- Great map system that guides players in the right direction and helps them search for secrets and activities. - A wide variety of weapons with different ashes of war that allows for diverse gameplay- An intuitive and efficient weapon upgrade system - A wide variety of spells, incantations, talismans, and armors to choose from - Stellar aesthetics/art design Cons:- Performance issues: micro-stuttering and framerate drops that got better compared to the launch version but still need more work - While enemies/bosses are mostly fair, a few of them are overly difficult and can feel a little cheap Overall, I think Elden Ring is a masterpiece that offers new possibilities to an open-world genre, which has become somewhat stale in recent years. Similar to what Breath of the Wild did five years ago, Elden Ring proves that the open-world genre can evolve and become something truly remarkable.

Emperor forgive me for I am about to speak heresy, but I cannot recommend this game, surely the ruinous powers have corrupted this gift from the Emperor. It plays like any button masher fighting game where you have to press the block button when the bright light icon flashes or press the dodge button when the other bright light flashes. Like other third person fighting button mashers of this genre, ( looking at you Shadow of War ) you're just a weak little guy that can get interrupted repeatedly by any and all enemies when making an attack but when you're right in the enemy's face with a chain sword the enemy acts as if all you're doing is poking them in the face with a stick. Compare this to a game like Bolt Gun where you feel the weight of a Space Marine, where you feel like a Space Marine, and this game comes up more like a clunky third person button masher fighting game rather than a tactical third person shooter where you play the role of a genetically engineered superhuman fighting hordes of xeno scum. 90% of the game I felt weaker than the enemy, and all the special xeno enemies usually just spammed some bs move like any third person button masher and if you miss the prompt, uh oh, there goes most of your health! Honestly the game is more frustrating and though the scenes were beautiful, the atmosphere of the 40k universe absolutely immersive and the overall amazing look of the game, it can't get beyond a clunky combat system that makes you feel more like you're playing Elden Ring having to spam dodge roll away from enemies because if a bunch of specials group up around you, you're basically dead. I know the whole being able to play as your favorite space marine chapter is something not seen much in other 40k video games but honestly, the PvE only has 6 missions at the moment, the PvP was tacked on seemingly at the last minute, and the campaign is an absolute joke for what it's claiming to be. Space Marine sim? The combination of clunky controls, auto hitting enemies with overpowered abilities, and mid to trash combat that makes you feel more like a member of the Astra Militarium than an Ultramarine.Edit: Why in Horus's great bushy bum did the devs decide to give the Tzeetch beastmen invulnerable shields that can only really be broken if you power attack them? That'd be like giving every Tyrannid grunt a shield and saying 'ah ah ah only power attacks' the amount of times I've been surrounded by these shield guys getting ripped apart by thousand sun space marines from a distance because I have to power attack through a whole horde of shielded enemies is completely ridiculous! It's a horde game, you want the low level enemies to be easily killed so you can focus on the high level enemies! Instead it turns into a mosh pit where you lose all your health because you have to focus power attack on each shield man while they keep hitting you every single second.

2023 This game on its own is ok but it is a true gem when you can assemble the previous games and its DLC into a state of completeness. I love this series and it will likely go down as one of my all time favorites. That being said, I cannot recommend this game for the very same reason.Creative Assembly has time and again left game breaking bugs for months upon months and have recently allowed a critical part of a paid DLC (Kroxigors for Nakai from The Hunter and the Beast) broken to the point that essentially half the DLC was unplayable. Don't worry, they were still happy to charge full price for it during this time. The most recent DLC has a massive price hike with debateably less content. On top of this, the FreeLC offers nowhere near the benefit of what has been historically accompanied a DLC release.The devs and artists do amazing work and create fantastic experiences when they're properly staffed and funded but I cannot recommend a game that is essentially the scaffolding to hang great DLC off of when the DLC and support is failing to deliver. This game is being treated as a money pinata by the leadership of the company to fund other projects and I cannot recommend this product or any other from Creative Assembly while it is so blatantly being given the least amount of attention possible while charging as much as possible.Edit: I want to make sure its clear that I cannot recommend a game or its DLC when its possible that what you buy may get critically broken and then not fixed for months. Even if the content itself is worth the price at the time there is no excuse to have multiple instances of paid-for content being left broken for months.

You will be forced to spend the next minutes of your life with them, I mean about people that must find the tree that produces the oxygen they spend and to whom they need to apologize for their inexcusable behavior towards other human beings. Valve doesn't give a flying fifu about your fun, or the toxic people you are forced to play with.It is nearly impossible to comprehend the level of toxicity and darkness that you will endure playing this game and having to live with this Exercise in futility, comparing this to works of Russian authors like Dostoevsky, Solzhenitsyn and Tolstoy will make you feel you are reading a woke Hollywood comedy.Old review --->I had a lot of fun some years back in the 2012-2014 reaching the rank of Supreme mostly playing with friends but also as solo. If you don't speak Russian you are doomed to play in competitive servers with people that don't speak English at all in about 80% of your matches, these guys use the VOIP system to speak Russian even if they are just 2 out the 5 players in your team, their only communication is shooting you or try to kick you if they think you do something wrong.DON'T GET ME WRONG HEREI have a lot of Russian friends through other games and they are really nice people.Apart from the Russians another portion of the community is immature people, they go harsh on teammates, bash them, trolling them and in generally trying to prove something, these disputes in many cases end up with the player being either the attacker or the defender leaving the game or getting banned for friendly fire, about 80% of the times you play you will end up playing a 4vs5 Match (at least in my DMG and LE levels that I played this year). This thing ruins the game too, it makes aiming really funny, you will understand If you ever go on a LAN server or play on a 128 tick rate server, this will result into playing a totally different game. The way the rates work now is that the attacking player has always the advantage as prefiring won't leave the defender time to react.There is huge but in all this:Are you willing to pay a subscription?If you have 4 dedicated friends to play the game with I guarantee you that you will have an excellent time if you decide to go play somewhere where you pay to play like ESEA and FACEIT with a better community. 2022 ELDEN RING, O ELDEN RING...Where to begin with this one? Fromsoftware's journey from Demon's Souls in 2009 all the way to here leaves us in the incredible foundations of what could be considered their best game yet, utilising the familiar Soulsborne format while spinning it into a full-fledged open world. The game is utterly jam packed with things to discover, fight, and oddball characters with weird, esoteric stories and motives. A game with an insane vision and incredible imagination.Having finished it about 160 hours in, my expectations probably should have been tempered. Context time; I've beaten almost every game in Fromsoftware's modern lineup with the exception of Demon's Souls, due to not owning a PS3 or PS5. I've gone out of my way to seek the greatest challenges, from Charmless/Demon Bell runs in Sekiro to the Queen Yharnam trophy in Bloodborne. Elden Ring starts off not too dissimilar to Dark Souls 3 and will seem incredibly familiar from there, with the magic meter returning (along with split Healing/magic bar flasks) and its weapon arts exchanged for a new system called Ashes of War, allowing you to chop and change various skills into a variety of mundane weapons, creating entirely brand new playstyles and strategies. Magic is stronger than ever with spell slots being completely independent of the stat that increases your magic bar, actively encouraging you to seek out magic to use. This makes the game's first stretch incredibly replayable as you experiment with various Ashes and spell and weapon combinations that compliment each other. Even better is that exploration from your first playthrough is rewarded in the next, as you can skip a surprising number of bosses and encounters to find strong equipment or spells early and use it as a base for your new run. This is some of the best character building in any of these games, and the world never stops being absolutely breathtaking to look at and experience.Unfortunately, it seems Elden Ring eventually buckles under its ambitions in an attempt to top what came before it. The game is relatively challenging from Limgrave all the way up to past the Altus Plateau and Leyndell, the Royal Capital, and then skyrockets in difficulty. In recognising that the game has to somehow challenge dozens of different player character builds and hundreds of potential Ash of War combinations, it becomes what might be Fromsoftware's hardest game ever put to code. What were once difficult bosses are now reused as regular enemies with impunity. Input reading is rampant, gank bosses are common place, enemies are Sekiro/Bloodborne-tier aggressive with staggered combos and extreme delays and area-of-effect attacks in a game where you play as a relatively slow Dark Souls 3 character. Lategame healthpools are absolutely titanic, difficult to stance break, and even characters with high damage numbers begin to struggle without help from summons, Bleed or Frostbite (especially Bleed, given it's a status proc that scales infinitely no matter how big the healthbar).The open world format both benefits and hurts the game, because almost all of its good design is in 60-80% of its runtime, with the last two areas being a gauntlet of no less than five of the absolute hardest bosses in the game. By the time I was done with those monsters-- four of which I could not at all beat without the help of a certain extremely strong spirit summon-- I was fatigued, and incredibly tired, rather than feeling accomplished at all. My advice is to play as dirty as humanly possible if you're struggling with those. It's a life or death battle, after all.Despite those few hitches just before an absolutely fantastic ending, I'd say Elden Ring is still worth your money and time, if you can spare either. Don't go in expecting anything other than another Dark Souls, this time with some of the words switched around and much bigger, and you'll have a grand time of it.

Having never played souls before I find this game incredibly hard, not so hard I want to destroy my controller - but damn hard. Pros:Graphics, voice-acting are good. An attempt was made to be faithful to the lore. Decent visuals of combat, good amount of finishers, gore, and satisfying kills.Weapon upgrade system provides some level of meta.Cons:Gameplay - clunky. the Space Marines don't move like Space Marines, but rather more like Fallout power armor... maybe even less agile. Do you want 6 different kinds of boltguns that all kinda suck? How about low ammo for all weapons? Remember the last little guy in Vermintide 1 that would do most of the damage after a fight? Those guys are in here.Price - very expensive for what you are gettingUI - very cumbersome: long presses with confirm windows are common, controls obviously made for console/controllerLore - they mostly do a decent job, but then will randomly have glaring errors. For instance, the Iron Warriors main colour being gold... what. The commanding officer of the Cadians has an accent different from her troops for... reasons? Speaking of, the Cadians are done dirty. They are in no way capable of holding the line against the Tyranids unless they are given plot armor. The banter between Space Marines is probably not something that would occur either. Some of the flavor text for the legions/chapters is wrong (Minotaurs come to mind). Scaling - is off. Vehicles are too small, CSM are too big compared to Primaris. Campaign/Story - 'Hey SM1, can I copy your homework? Sure, just change it a bit so it looks different."Other game modes:Operations (PVE): linear maps, same objectives, same maps, same enemies. Eternal War (PVP): I had no interest in playing. Obviously tacked on at the end. Chaos doesnt have any cosmetic customization other than color. For instance, do you want a green World Eater? How about a yellow Deathguard? CSM weapons are the same, even though they shouldn't be (they are reskins of primaris equivalents).Classes - absolute cancer. You are restricted to only taking 1 class on missions (so of 3 players in PVE, they MUST be a unique class). Maybe this is primaris ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ or maybe this is a gameplay choice. Not sure, but it seems like a random injection of hero shooter to something that isnt. This game is gonna have a very short lifespan. Compared to other 40k titles that have released recently, this simply does not compete.I'll probably keep playing it, as several of my friends are and request my assistance... and to get my money's worth.

2022 Elden RingLet me start by saying this was the first game I played created by FromSoftware (well except for killing the first boss in DS3 - which doesn't really count, does it?). I wasn't caught up in the Elden Ring hype and I wasn't really interested in the game even after it's release. It didn't even come up in my mind to even look at it, as I thought it wouldn't be the right game for me. And oh boy was that a mistake. About a month ago I finally decided to look into the game and almost instantly decided to get it.Not being interested in the game from the start actually made me enjoy it that much more. I wasn't hyped up from any trailers, media or rumors. I went into the game with a clean slate. And it was amazing. From the first time hearing the AWESOME soundtrack in the menu to exploring the crazy world of Lands Between - and let me tell you I barely scratched the surface of what the world has to offer.The world really feels alive. It's crazy how from previous - mostly linear - games the devs managed to create such an impressive open world. The map is HUGE and there isn't an area which feels empty and out of place. Each location really feels different and tells it's own story.There are some let's say tedious locations, I'm looking at you Mountaintops of the Giants, that get a bit annoying after playing through the game several times. Nevertheless even these snow-covered depressing hills deserve a special places in any gamer's heart. I won't mention any other locations because it would be a sin to spoil any of them.Locations being behind us, let's move onto the people inhabiting the Lands Between. The NPCs are there for themselves not for the player. That makes them feel really alive - you've never met this guy? Well he certainly doesn't care because he was doing his thing anyways. And that's crazy. The world is constantly evolving and the NPCs are too. And not just that, the people you meet during your adventure are as interesting as it gets. There weren't many times I could certainly say "Okay, this NPC is good, pure-hearted and they will surely stay that way!". The craziest thing is you might not meet even half of the NPCs if you're just playing the game for the sake of reaching the end.Bosses will kick your ass and those bastards will look cool doing it. Damn I wish I was born a cool boss too. But hey tough luck foul tarnished. Get some shiny gear and kick their ass for a change. After all you're ambitious and surely not foolish at all - Margit the goat fanboy.Elden Ring has 6 unique endings. That's all I'm gonna say about that. Though don't expect to be an Elden Ring Expert after your first... or tenth playthrough. The lore is, as FromSoft is known for, hidden in every possible way there is. You get a new weapon? You thought, it's lore in disguise. You got a completely useless pot which is completely useless? Oh wait it's got ten paragraphs of lore in it's description. Honestly if you really want to know atleast a bit of lore or you're interested in a certain character, I recommend you to look up external sources about them, such as youtube videos or useful lore sites. But be warned, there are still numerous mysteries which even the most notorious loreheads are still uncertain about. But hey, that's the beauty of it all, isn't it?I have to say, I don't think there currently is and for a long time will be any better entry point to FromSoft games. Even though, Elden Ring still doesn't exactly help you get through and still kicks your ass every chance it gets, it's a fun ass kicking. And I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone even a bit interested in the genre or in the game itself.It might even be time to announce a DLC reveal, what do you say FromSoft? ...pretty please?TLDR: Game of the year - do I need to add anything else? Wait... Actually I do. There are Waifus. FromSoft boys truly outdone themselves.

2022 The gameplay, race options, the prologue and the overall experience (strategic game) are fun and impressive. The game is beautiful and immersive. But, and it's a rage quit kind of but, you hit turn 30 of the chaos campaign and the mechanics kicks in and it all goes downhill. While the portals are exciting and some of the realm are fun and thematic, having other factions rush you at that time (preventing you from visiting them) and having the realm experience feel long and unfair (at least you can auto-resolve the last battle) drains the fun out of it. I finished it once, made it to the fourth soul before deciding it wasn't worth finishing on the 2nd playthrough and keep dropping out earlier and earlier on the other playthrough I've tried. Overall, I feel there's a really fun game underneath but that the campaign kills the enjoyment out of it. Having played the immortal empire campaign my review kinda stands : it feels ridiculously unbalanced from one faction to the next and, having tried many, I'm finding that it's a mix of fun and frustration. The base game fun is there but playing whack-a-mole on armies trashing your unprotectable smaller settlements, the sometimes stacked-against-you-against-logic of the AI and very uneven enjoyability of the different races and mechanics makes playing the game a frustrating experience.

At the moment the gameplay loop is just ♥♥♥♥♥♥For melee:- Chip damage is way to high with no tools of either preventing it, or replenishing health. (EDIT: A melee with "fencing" defence type has significantly reduced this problem)- The idea of trying to keep getting armour as if it was replenishing health just isn't a sound one. The chances to replenish it are rare, but on top of that armour has such little HP and therefore what you regain is insignificant and often immediately lost. - Parry is so odd. Not only have I found that holding the parry button delivers better results, but also a successful parry timing is done BEFORE the hit would land, unlike all other famous parry systems.This is not an inherently bad idea, I think it's quite novel and interesting. Especially with the imagery of a parry that is prepared for being better than a parry that is "just in time". However this utterly ♥♥♥♥♥ the bed against small enemies in hordes. There is no predicting in a horde, there are attacks all the time and when you see an enemy wind up and you prepare to parry, that parry is highjacked by a random enemy that you weren't prepared for, turning your Perfect Parry into the ♥♥♥♥ parry. This leads to you getting STUNLOCKED which is a cardinal ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sin in games like these. Absolute wank. (EDIT: This is completely removed by using a "Fencing" defence type weapon. Using one removes the "just in time" parry and makes all successful parries the same *actual* parry. Although this makes the game much much more playable and fun and removes the stunlocking, I kinda liked the preparing idea and would like to see it delegated to rare and boss heavy attacks).Ranged:- Guns feel like ♥♥♥♥♥ in terms of damage. A Rubric Marine cannot tank 20 Bolt rounds to the face unless the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is named.- Ammo is rare as ♥♥♥♥ and because of the mentioned above, is absolutely useless as you burn right through it. I only don't feel this rarity when maining a melee class for obvious reasons.Misc:- What the everliving ♥♥♥♥ did they do to the Jump Pack in Operations? I don't give a ♥♥♥♥ if I could fall out the map, just spawn me on top of a Player or NPC if that happens. There is no good reason to have neutered it so massively.- also why is customisation just kind of poor? I guess more will come later but just in what I'm able to change, SM1 was superior. Why can't I change lens colour or thigh armour colour? And the fact there is only Mark X ♥♥♥♥♥ me off. Give me my gorgeous Mk 7 helmet and please don't make me pay £10 for it.- The loading screens are abysmal and absurd. Sometimes it is faster to task manager the game out of existence than to sit through loading screens- EDIT: the new fencing weapons feel kind of OP? I know it sounds like I'm complaining that one of my problems mentioned above is now fixed, but I can now just spam-parry my way out of minor-hordes. Not very engaging, stimulating or cognitive.Fixes:- Either reduce the damage Minor enemies deal in melee (one Tzeench minion should not take a whole bar off my shield), OR increase shield HP (shield HP is decent in Mini-boss events like Helbrutes so if HP is raised, so should Helbrute's damage by slightly), OR increase shield regen from specific enemy executions. Rubric marines should not give 1 shield with how much damage they deal, OR increase the health recovery after taking damage lifespan. It goes away far to fast to actually act upon.- Have an more purposeful way to regain shield. I get nearly all of my Gun Strikes just unexpectedly, even though I'm always attempting to bash and stun enemies. Make bashing leading to a Gun Strike more consistent for minor enemies. - You should not have to use the Prepare Parry mechanic for minor enemies. Not only does it play like ♥♥♥♥, they just aren't strong strong enough to put a Space Marine on the back foot.- Buff the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Jump pack in Operations. It should go as far and be active as much as the campaign or PVP. "Oh the slam, it would be too OP" then nerf the slam damage dibshit.I'm going to keep playing this game every now and then in hopes that the higher class level experience is better, but it can't be a good game if I have to slog through ♥♥♥♥ for 25 hours just to get it to play nice. Also I haven't tried PVP yet but I didn't come here to do that, I came to slaughter xenos and traitors and indulge in a rare substance called fun.

A Kaleidoscope Of FunOnce Human invites players into a world fraught with fear, where lifeless objects reanimate into hostile creatures intent on human extinction. Guided by an otherworldly figure, players must battle formidable boss-type enemies to edge closer to a prospective salvation, which remains uncertain. Amidst these dangers, bonds of friendship and camaraderie strengthen among the inhabitants. Forging new armors and weapons enhances survivability, erecting walls and defenses safeguards against threats, and collecting Deviations (the game’s equivalent of Pokémon) advances players into adept survivalists.GameplayThe core gameplay of Once Human revolves around survival-craft, with a primary focus on resource gathering. This aspect is well-balanced, avoiding an excessively grindy feel. Base building epitomizes this balance, as creating a fully furnished home requires only a few hours of resource gathering and planning.Crafting is efficient, with most recipes completing in seconds. Bulk crafting takes only a few minutes, providing time to manage the base or review character skills and stats. Various methods to expedite and increase the yield of crafting items cater to those with limited patience.Deviations, the game’s Pokémon-esque companions, are found through quests or at the end of boss levels. They serve various roles, from crafting and gathering resources to combat. Unlike its contemporary Palworld, which offers numerous companions, Once Human makes them rarer, enhancing their impact. Players are encouraged to experiment to find the Deviation that best suits their playstyle.Gunplay is satisfying, encouraging players to seek cover and capitalize on attack opportunities. While reminiscent of The Division, it is less complex. Combat includes a dodge-roll, frequently used in boss fights and player skirmishes. Smooth animations add weight to actions, showcasing the development team’s attention to detail.Quests are scattered throughout the world, with main quests guiding the narrative and side quests rewarding players with Deviations, experience points, and resources. Various world quests incite the server’s population to either collaborate or compete for victory and rewards. PvP enthusiasts will appreciate the forced-PvP high-value locations, akin to The Division’s “Dark Zone.”Areas for ImprovementAs a new game, Once Human has a few bugs, though none cause crashes. Visual glitches, such as weapons not appearing in hands or enemies teleporting when stuck in walls, are noticeable. These issues are likely to be addressed in future updates.While crafting is generally balanced, collecting wood takes longer relative to its usage. Converting wood to charcoal for smelting ores and crafting ammo depletes the resource quickly.The abundance of menus can be overwhelming, making navigation and reward claiming challenging. The game has much to offer but requires better visual organization. UI/UX improvements are essential to enhance the overall experience.SummaryIn conclusion, Once Human offers a kaleidoscope of engaging mechanics, presenting a visually stunning world with thrilling combat and survival elements. With a dedicated development team that values player feedback and respects players’ time, this game has strong potential to evolve into something exceptional. Embark on this immersive journey and uncover the true essence of survival.

2022 What can I say? Honestly I do not know how I can talk about this game in its current state, as I write this review I have played WH1, 2 and now 3 and honestly this game feels like early access, the unit mass is off, formations feels like they dont matter because Orgres spam, Demon Spam, Chariot spam and even BASIC infantry can just barge through your space marine kislevites and your halbardiers like a wet paper bag. Range units cant fire less than 10 degrees without moving the whole unit and by the way... they're a lot slower now as all infantry is.. oh and none of them can fire if ONE of them is caught on a twig (or another enemy unit in this case). And as I mentioned earlier, your big strong, anti-large infantry? yeah.. paper bag. (or in my experience, facing the wrong way because ONE Orgre, soul grinder or chariot decided to run decided to run through them and now the whole unit is being attacked from behind, shot at and targeted down because the archers looked tasty.) *This is one of MANY examples by the way, there is simply too many more for me to count*This is one issue I have noticed out of place, too many to even count, I have tried to watch Youtubers to see if I am going something wrong and I am not, simply the game is unbalanced, half finished and simply frustrating to play in its current state as it is full as bugs. (look at ElichTV and his Great Book of Bugs) So how do we fix this? oh lets release a multiplayer patch and then a patch for Alt Tab or something idk. What about fixing issues with the game? oh no lets just explain its very complicated to do. Okay so what will you do for the fans? Lets write a blog post fix some of the things early next month. This is not good enough for a AAA game studio, its honestly so saddening, disappointing and borderline infuriating.I'll just end it on this. Long story short I can go on and on and on about all the unbalanced autoresolve or paper bag infantry who are either killed too quickly or sent halfway across the map by my chariot to get back up again as an angry armoured bear and Co. smashing into you does nothing, but this game is not worth your money, wait for a discount or a decent patch in the next year or five. CA, if you ever read this, next time listen to your fans and the YOUTUBERS you USED to SELL YOUR BROKEN GAME and have THOUSANDS of hours in your games, as personally I believe they know more about what needs to change than what you do and the probability is, you can make MORE MONEY from it if thats all you truly care about as the game will be what the players want and not some broken, overpriced early access launch that you make up excuses for. PS, I am sorry if this review is all over the place, I've never been the best at writing and explaining myself but I think the point I'm making is clear, this game currently is not worth it.

Although Once Human is a well made and entertaining game, I can only recommend it to players with plenty of spare time or are happy to rush through the game to complete it before the 6 week season ends. Once Human needs private servers or 'permanent seasons (with no server wipes)' for a number of reasons, including:- Casual players want to take their time to explore the map - There is far too much content to cover in 6 weeks for players who work and/or have limited play time - Some players primarily enjoy the base building aspect and don't want their experience, deviants and base wiped - Having both seasonal and private/permanent servers would provide a variety of game development, community growth and moneymaking opportunities for developers.Side note: Content you buy with real world money should be transferable to other worlds/servers (it isn't at the moment).I will be waiting for these important issues to be dealt with before I commit to adding Once Human to my permanent game rotation.

2022 This game is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ disgrace which is saying a lot even for a CA game. I've literally never written a review but this game....oh boy this game, I'll make an exception for.2 long legendary campaigns (140 hours at time of writing and thousands on total war games in general) ended abruptly when I couldn't teleport to the *SPOILER* forge of souls to intercept the enemy. I literally got the prompt to go there so I did, and waited there for 10+ turns. No battle option ever came up and upon one of my turns completing was given 'you've failed to intercept, campaign lost'. Like seriously? Didn't have the option with BOTH campaigns. This isn't even an isolated issue. Search up 'forge of souls issue' and it feels like no ones able to finish a campaign. How did this garbage get past playtesting? Not to mention the Tzeentch faction mechanic of just pausing all your movement for a turn. You know what makes warhammer suck in real life? Uninteractable 'gotchas' that require no skill and you can't do ♥♥♥♥ about them. With normal overworld you can at least assasinate/wound heroes that try to block your movement. This is just a random frustration feature that adds nothing to gameplay Why would you give this to the ai when its not being used by a player? How does this enhance or add to the strategic play of the game when it randomly stops all your strategic movement EVERY 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ TURNS, how can you be so oblivious to such an obviously trash and frustrating feature?Everyone who tells you they like minor settlement battles hasn't played 100000 of them on every campaign that isn't on toddler difficulty. Too long, nonsensical, too frequent, and autoresolve just sucks (t5 garrisons 'decisive loss' vs t1 unit rebel blobs. In battle itself - I have no idea if this is intentional but it is still trash of a mechanic-your units response times are like a dial up internet connection to china in 1990. I sincerely hope this is a me incident but compared to other total warhammer games or even total war games in general your units have terrible response times to commands. This could be another attempt at a 'feature' that just ends up being frustration inducing.'realism' dictates a lag in executing orders after receiving them but this is still a game. I'm not looking to fight my own units to go forwards. Maybe its to make it harder to dodge magic but just feels like meaningless lag added to piss you off. Speaking of further pissing someone off, missile units are worse than ever with pathfinding. hundreds of times i've had them shoot something literally in front of them with no impediments and not only will they not fire but they'll just run straight into melee. Other TW games had this issue too but never to this extent. Its too the point where I don't even want to issue attack orders with a line of missile troops because its so hard to have them shoot to begin with without having to micro all of them to not charge into them when its an unimpeded sight line to the target. I was super excited to try out cathays close range rifles until I realized they never fired at your target unless they were autotargeting. Its like they took everything good about the other TW WH games and just made them suck. Oh not to mention unit formations means ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when even the ai just decides to pull entire units through your ranks or a shieldwall to touch your archers or artillery.With crap mechanics and unstable gameplay, I wouldn't touch this game until a couple years after launch and they remove the stupid mechanics they added. There are improvements to diplomacy like allegiance income and trading settlements, but fudnamentally, this game feels clunky, unresponsive, and is frustrating to play.Wait till patches fix everything.

2022 After 100 hours i can say that its one of my favourite games ever and it might just be my favourite Fromsoft title. For me, they nailed every aspect of what i love about the Souls titles and put it into an expansive and aesthetically gorgeous world. Being honest i cannot praise the visual and area design enough, it feels like Ds1 but larger and more grand. I personally hail Ds1's design as "perfect" as can be so take what i said as you will. As usual the music is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ fantastic too. So so many new types of spells and incantations which open up many more interesting types of builds than we've had before. Ive personally planned a multitude of themed characters to play through both in PvP and PvE. The lore of Elden Ring is also superb and i think also the most accessible lore so far in a Fromsoft title. Also General Radahn is an absolute chad. My only criticisms of Elden Ring would be the copy pasted bosses as general enemies in late areas of the game or having 2x the boss for a boss fight. I personally feel like they're a crutch and also diminish earlier emotions of victory from beating a boss and 2x bosses in an area is, IMO, "lazy" Elden Ring is a BIG game, perhaps one of the largest ive ever played but to me everything about Elden Ring is big and grand and just absolutely deserves your attention. No other game company has made an open world game so well as Fromsoft.

Product received for free Black Myth Wukong จากตัวละครในสุดยอดวรรณกรรมจีนอันโด่งดังสู่เกม Action แนว Hack & Slash เดินหน้าฟันดะแต่ความยากเทียบเท่าระดับน้อง ๆ Sekiro ด้วยคอนเซ็ปต์อาร์ตดาร์ค ๆ มืดหม่น และการดีไซน์ตัวศัตรูให้ดูน่ากลัวหลอน ๆ และท่วงท่าการโจมตีที่กะจังหวะหลบได้ยาก กลิ่นอายของ Soulslike ยังอยู่ในเกมนี้อย่างครบถ้วน หากจะเข้าไปฟันกันโต้ง ๆ คงได้กลับไปเกิดจุดเซฟรัว ๆ อย่างแน่นอน ดีกรีความยากต้องขอบอกว่าเล่นจนหัวร้อนถึงขั้นเปิดแอร์เบอร์ 25แล้วเอาพัดลมเป่าตัว เหงื่อถึงจะหยุดไหลกันเลยทีเดียว(เรื่องจริงนะ) และเกมนี้มีความยากระดับเดียวไม่มีตัวเลือกให้ปรับแต่งแต่อย่างใดอีกต่างหากซุนหงอคงคือตัวละครหลักที่เราจะได้เล่น มากับฉากเปิดตัวเต็มไปด้วยความตระการตา ทั้งฉากต่อสู้และเสียงเพลงประกอบ พลันให้ขนบนตัวลุกซู่ขึ้นมา พร้อมกับ Tutorial เล็ก ๆ น้อย ๆ ก่อนที่จะให้เราได้เริ่มเกมจริง ๆ โดยคอนเทนท์เกมในส่วนต่าง ๆ จะปลดล็อกออกไปตามเนื้อเรื่องทีละนิด ๆ เช่น การสร้างอาวุธ ชุดเกราะ การอัพสกิลทักษะ ยา หรือกระทั่งวิญญาณที่เรียกออกมาให้ช่วยสู้ด้านกราฟฟิคเนื่องจากผู้เขียนได้เกมฟรีจากการซื้อการ์ดจอของค่ายเขียวยี่ห้อ Galax 4070 แบบธรรมดา 12Gb ตัวเกมปรับกราฟฟิคเป็นสูงสุดมาให้อัตโนมัติตั้งแต่เข้าเกมมาและด้วยขุมพลังของ CPU Intel I7 10700 สามารถทำเฟรมเรทได้ที่ 55+ ไม่ต่ำไปกว่านี้ถือว่าค่อนข้างโอเค และรองรับ DLSS เต็มรูปแบบ การประมวลผลภาพที่ได้มาคือ “ขนลิงมันเป็นขนลิงเลยอะ” ขนเป็นขน เนียนกริ๊บ แสงเงา เท็กส์เจอร์ก้อนหิน ใบไม้ หรือเงาต่าง ๆ ถือว่าทำออกมาได้ดีมาก ส่วนปัญหาเรื่องกราฟฟิคมีเพียงช่วงเปลี่ยนฉากทิศทางแสงจะเปลี่ยนอย่างเห็นได้ชัดเจน อย่างเช่นอยู่ในถ้ำเราจะเห็นแดดนอกถ้ำทะแยงแสงมาจากฝั่งขวา แต่พอออกจากถ้ำแล้วมีการโหลดฉาก แสงก็เปลี่ยนทิศทางไปเป็นฝั่งซ้ายเฉยเลย...ก็มีบ้างเนื้อเรื่องตัวเกมทำออกมาได้เรียบง่าย เส้นทางค่อนข้างเป็นทางตรง มีทางแยกบ้าง แต่สุดท้ายก็จะไปบรรจบที่เดียวกัน ถึงจะดูเหมือนเส้นตรงก็จริงแต่ด้วยความที่เกมไม่ได้มอบมินิแมพหรือแผนที่มาให้เลย อาจทำให้มีหลงเส้นทางอยู่บ้างในช่วงเริ่มแรก แต่ก็มีคุณค่ามากพอแก่การเดินหลงสำรวจให้ครบถ้วน เพราะจะมีไอเทมหรือบอสลับอยู่มากมายรอคอยการเจอของคุณอยู่ เมื่อค้นพบหรือเอาชนะมันลงได้ อาจได้รับไอเทมที่ใช้ในการอัพเกรดของต่าง ๆ และสามารถนำไปอัพเกรดได้ที่ศาลเจ้าที่เปรียบเสมือนจุด Checkpoint และจุดเกิดซึ่งเรียงรายอยู่ตามทางได้ศัตรูเกมนี้จะมีออกมาตามทางให้เป็นระยะ ๆ ไม่ล้นเกร่อแบบเกมออนไลน์ทั่วไป อย่างจำพวกกี้ ๆ จะมาพอให้กรุ้มกริ่มเป็นการวอร์มอัพข้อมือข้อนิ้วก่อนจะไปเจอมินิบอสที่เรียงรายตามทางทุก ๆ 10-15นาที ฝีมือบางตัวร้ายการพอฟัดพอเหวี่ยง บางตัวปรากฏตัวอย่างอลังการขู่ขวัญเราด้วยขนาดตัวและกล้ามล่ำ ๆ แต่หากเราจับทริคมันได้จะง่ายขึ้นมาก บางตัวแทบไม่จำเป็นต้องใช้ยาเลย แต่แลกกับการตายซ้ำซากอยู่นานโขและอาจซื้อจอยอันใหม่มาแทนที่ หรืออย่างร้ายสุดคือตายจนจำบทพูดเย้ยหยันของบอสจนเอาไปพูดตามได้เลย (ฮา)ศัตรูแต่ละตัวหากเราฆ่าได้เป็นตัวแรกจะปลดล็อกเนื้อหาของมัน สามารถเข้าถึงเรื่องราวเกี่ยวกับศัตรูตัวนั้น และเมื่อพิชิตบอสประจำฉากได้จะมีอนิเมชั่นให้เราได้ดูเนื้อเรื่อง อีกทั้งสามารถดูแผนผังและคำบรรยายของภาพนั้นหลังจากจบฉากนั้นได้อีกด้วยการต่อสู้ในเกมนี้ทำได้ค่อนข้างสนุก กระชับ ชัดเจน ใช้โจมตีเบาเพื่อสะสมเกจพลังเพื่อโจมตีหนักใช้เป็นคอมโบต่อเนื่องหรือจะชาร์จเพื่อโจมตีหนักทีเดียวแบบหนักหน่วงก็ได้ตามสไตล์ของเรา ท่วงท่าการโจมตีมีให้ถึงสามแบบด้วยกัน ซึ่งแต่ละสกิลมีให้อัพแยกย่อยลงมาอีกมากมาย อีกทั้งทักษะแขนงอื่นอย่างทักษะติดตัว เพิ่มเลือด เพิ่มมานา หรือสเตมิน่า มาคอยให้เราเก็บเวลได้ติดงอมแงมแบบกู่ไม่กลับแน่นอน แต่ถ้าถามว่ามีข้อเสียไหมในระบบการต่อสู้เกมนี้ ต้องขอตอบว่ามี และเป็นข้อเสียขนาดใหญ่เสียด้วย(เป็นความคิดเห็นส่วนตัว) นั่นคือมุมกล้องที่ออกแบบมาได้แคบมาก และไม่มีตัวเลือกให้ปรับให้มุมมองกว้างขึ้นมาได้ อีกทั้งหากสู้ในที่แคบ ๆ มุมกล้องเราจะไม่ทะลุกำแพง นั่นหมายความว่ามุมมองเราจะถูกบีบให้ใกล้ตัวละครจนเห็นแต่หลังตัวละคร หรือบางครั้งการล็อกเป้าหมายโจมตีศัตรูที่ตัวเตี้ยกว่า มุมกล้องเราจะถูกกดให้ต่ำลง ส่งผลให้มองเห็นแค่พื้นในมุมมองที่แคบ หากเราถูกรุม เป็นเรื่องยากมากที่จะไม่เสียเลือดเสียเนื้อ นอกจากคนเล่นจะเป็นนิวไทป์น่ะนะ... และอีกข้อหนึ่งที่สำคัญ หากเราต้องการชาร์จโจมตีหนักที่ต้องกด Y (XBOX) หรือ ปุ่มสามเหลี่ยม(PS) โดยใช้นิ้วหัวแม่มือขวา จะทำให้เราเปลี่ยนมุมกล้องด้วยแกน แอนนาล็อกด้านไม่ได้หรือไม่ถนัดเลย ทำให้การชาร์จโจมตีหนักนั้น ก้านคอของตัวละครจะกลายเป็นอัมพาตทันทีเนื่องจากหันมุมกล้องแทบเป็นไปไม่ได้หรือได้แต่ยากมาก ๆ ซึ่งอาจต้องอาศัยนิ้วชี้ที่ไม่ถนัดเลยในการกดแทนที่พลาดไม่ได้คือระบบ Spell ที่บริโภคค่ามานาไว้คอยขัดจังหวะการโจมตีของศัตรูได้อย่างเห็นผลชะงักและพลิกให้ไพ่ของเราอยู่เหนือกว่าพวกมันได้เพียงอึดใจ ในตอนแรก Spell จะมีผลออกมาได้ไม่ค่อยดีนัก ซึ่งเราต้องอัพสกิลเพื่อให้มีประสิทธิภาพประสิทธิผลที่ดียิ่งขึ้น แต่ต้องแลกกับการไม่ได้อัพสกิลสายต่อสู้ แต่เกมค่อนข้างอิสระในการอัพพอสมควรเพื่อให้เข้ากับสไตล์การต่อสู้ของเราเอง แต่ใช่ว่ามาถึงจะอัพค่ามานา 5เลเวลแรกเลยนะ เดี๋ยวช่วงแรกจะไม่มีท่าคอมโบใช้สู้ใด ๆ เลยเด้อต่อมาก็เป็นระบบเครื่องสวมใส่ เกมนี้จะไม่ได้เป็นการสุ่มดรอปอย่างเกม Soulslike ทั่ว ๆ ไป แต่จะเป็นการคราฟท์แบบตายตัวเมื่อคุณพิชิตบอสได้สำเร็จ อาวุธและชุดเกราะใหม่ถึงจะถูกปลดล็อกมาให้คราฟท์ได้ ไอเทมคราฟท์หาได้ตามหีบในฉากที่ซ่อนอยู่ หรือบ้างก็ดรอปจากมอนสเตอร์หรือว่าพวกมินิบอสกับบอส ส่วน Will(ค่าเงินในเกม) จะได้จากการดูดวิญญาณสีเขียวเข้าน้ำเต้าจากการสังหารศัตรู (แอบเหมือนเกม Onimusha เหมือนกันแฮะ) โดยค่า Will จะใช้ในการซื้อไอเทมหรือใช่เป็นค่าอัพเกรดอาวุธชุดเกราะหรือวิญญาณที่ช่วยเราต่อสู้ได้อีกด้วย และด้วยวิธีการอัพเกรดที่ล็อกตายตัวของเกมนี้ ทำให้เราไม่ได้รู้สึกเก่งขึ้นเมื่อเจอบอสที่เก่งขึ้นตัวถัดไป เพียงแค่ไม่ได้ทำให้เรากระจอกลงเท่านั้นเอง ครั้นจะเก็บเลเวลให้สูง ๆ ไปสู้กับมันก็ใช้เวลานาน เพราะศัตรูอยู่กระจายไม่กระจุกซึ่งเสียเวลาโดยใช่เหตุ สรุปได้ว่าอย่างไรเสียเกมนี้ก็ต้องพึ่งฝีมือถึง 50%เลยทีเดียว 30% เป็นทักษะที่เราอัพ 10%เป็นไอเทมสวมใส่ และอีก10% ค่าน้ำเต้าเพิ่มพลังน้ำเต้าเพิ่มพลังเกมนี้มีลูกเล่นอยู่บ้างเล็กน้อย โดยเราสามารถเลือกรูปแบบน้ำเต้าให้มีออพชั่นเสริม หลังจากนั้นก็มีให้เลือกรูปแบบน้ำยาได้อีกว่าต้องการให้มีผลการฟื้นฟูเลือดอย่างไร สุดท้ายคล้าย ๆ กับเพิ่มลูกกลอนในตัวน้ำยาไว้เพิ่มบัฟหลังจากที่ดื่มน้ำเต้าไป การจะอัพเกรดได้จำเป็นต้องใช้ไอเทมเฉพาะมาอัพ มันจะเป็นผลเหลือง ๆ ของต้นไม้ที่มีศัตรูโหด ๆ เฝ้าแทบทุกต้นเลย เป็นการบอกกลาย ๆ ว่าถ้าอยากเก่งขึ้นคุณต้องเก่งกว่ามันให้ได้เสียก่อน นอกจากน้ำเต้าจะช่วยดูดวิญญาณศัตรูในเกมแล้ว ยังดูดวิญญาณเราให้คอยหาค่า Will มาอัพพวกนี้อีกด้วยสิเนี่ย(ให้ตายสิ)Spirit หรือวิญญาณจากศัตรูที่ได้จากการสังหารนั้น เราสามารถสวมใส่เพื่อเรียกใช้เป็นสกิลมาโจมตีศัตรูได้ เราจะได้ Spirit จากศัตรูพิเศษโดยสังเกตได้จากศัตรูที่ติดไฟสีฟ้ารอบตัวและจะเก่งกาจกว่าปกติเล็กน้อย แต่ละแบบจะมีเพียงตัวเดียวเท่านั้น ฉะนั้นเดินหาให้ทั่ว ๆ จะเป็นการดีที่สุด แต่หากคุณพลาด สามารถเดินทางกลับได้ตลอดเวลาด้วยศาลเจ้า และ Relic ที่ได้รับหลังจากชนะบอสประจำฉากจะสามารถเลือกความสามารถติดตัวได้ 1ข้อ จาก 1ใน3ข้อเสียของเกมคงไม่เหมาะสำหรับผู้เล่นที่ได้อัพสกิลแล้วรู้สึกว่าต้องสู้ได้ง่ายขึ้น สำหรับเกมนี้คืออัพสกิลแล้วสู้ไม่ง่ายขึ้น แต่สู้ได้ลื่นไหลขึ้น จังหวะต่อเนื่องมากขึ้นเท่านั้น ส่วนการอัพอาวุธและชุดเกราะไม่ค่อยหลากหลายสักเท่าไหร่ และออพชั่นเซ็ทบางชุดไม่ค่อยเห็นผลอย่างมีนัยยะสำคัญมากนัก และด้วยข้อนี้อาจจะไม่ค่อยมีแรงจูงใจในการให้เรารู้สึกอยากฟาร์มหาอาวุธหรือไอเทมอัพเกรดที่ทำให้รู้สึกสู้ได้ง่ายขึ้นเลย Product received for free I've finished the campaign and have a few more hours. I have some additional points I want to add while still maintaining my original points. I have friends to play with but a lot of the time I only have so much time or I just want to play alone. Steam having this in the single player category with the tag and, the promises of the devs to be able to progress solo caught my attention. Especially with this having a huge emphasis on co-op, that got me incredibly interested. That's the kind of basis I'd like to start with. Obviously these are just my points and opinions. Feel free to disagreeBad Points are:-SM2 has tried on every startup to install EOS. You can stop the installation if you'd like but I've read that it is tied and, essential to cross-platform play. It's an odd choice when most pc players (I think) will be on Steam based on the community consensus of Epic-Data Collection is on and required by default. You cannot disagree to the prompt in game. Lord knows what kind of data is actually being collected, as I'm sure is defined somewhere in the fine print like usual. This is plainly unacceptable.-Progression is tied to online services. I don't believe this applies to the campaign, I repeat this doesn't affect the campaign but, you won't be leveling up your classes while offline. I've seen a lot of people try to say based off of that, that this isn't a Live Service game. You will be wasting your time, you will not be progressing if you don't play online. Online services are a core part of this game. I absolutely hate Live Service games bc, one bad patch, one bad decision from the devs could potentially destroy the game and it's future. Helldivers 2 is a good example of being the biggest, best and fan favorite game of the year quickly turning into a very unenjoyable one. This Live Service model needs to go.-Playing solo is not possible while maintaining your online status in the Operations Gamemode. You're forced into a server, and to play with others. The devs stated it would be possible to play alone and make progress but, to my knowledge it isn't possible at this time. So if you're short on time, like to play casually, or just want to play alone, it will not be possible.-You cannot customize your Space Marine in the campaign or use classes. There are pre-applied skins that you can use with Titus in the campaign but to my knowledge the only skin I've seen, comes with the ultimate edition. Nor can you use classes in the campaign. The campaign will most likely be a sort of intro into the game and it's mechanics for most players and will be untouched after completion.-There is really not a lot of content to play through right now. You will get bored very quickly grinding the same missions repeatedly. Do expect more content in the future but I would wait a few months.-I personally do not care for the most of the classes, nor their abilities. I liked tactical and sniper but I cannot stand the equipment that you are limited to with some of the other classes. I didn't watch this game like a hawk as some did but, when I first picked it up, I didn't think the classes would be so neutered in what weapons they're able to equip. Especially after finishing the campaign, I felt extremely limited in my options.-The performance in my experience isn't terrible but it's extremely inconsistent. My GPU and CPU will jumping all over the place. My FPS never got over 60-65 no matter what settings I tried. I have an good pc and even then, I don't like running my system too hard. I couldn't find a nice middle ground between performance and visuals. Definitely going to need some smoothing out.-The melee combat is rough in my experience. The horrid key-binds make it worse but after remedying that, I found that hitting parry to the blue prompts, or dodging the red ones, half the time didn't register. There's always the possibility of human error here but it seems I am not the only one experiencing this.-As for the editions, there's only one other than the base edition that I even consider. If you'd like to get the season pass as well as some of the skins, I would recommend the Gold Edition but, the Ultimate Edition (UE) is plainly disappointing. Especially since the skins are not universal. Ex. Titus's skin from the UE can't be used in Operations or PvP. The only class-based skin you get is, I believe, for the heavy class only and, that can't be used in the campaign. You get three other skins I think for certain weapons but again, they're not universal so I can't exactly say it's worth it. Just do not buy the UE. It simply isn't worth it. I bought the Ultimate Edition for a hefty discount from another store. I'd advise looking into that if you still want the UE but $100, heck even the $90 Gold edition just to play the game early, get the season pass and, a few skins is not enough to justify that price tag. Absolutely outrageous. The Good Points are:-The game's performance isn't great but I didn't experience crashes like a lot of others did. I have crashed maybe once. There were times when I thought a bunch of stuttering would lead to more crashes but they didn't. I'm reading that some people can't get past the first cut scene... -The gunplay feels great. The variety between the guns not so much but the smooth reload animations and everything looks really good.-The graphics are beautiful. The devs really knocked it out of the park.-The Campaign's story although very short, is great. I am not very fluent in Warhammer lore so I can't say how it is lore wise but, I was happy with it.I have much more criticisms of this game than I have praise but, this review will turn to positive when the devs smooth out the performance, rebalancing the classes is a must IMO as some are quite bad. then to deliver on promises of playing solo for us solo players and the casuals. This is a typical game where the devs say it'll have features and, performance etc. just not at launch... give us a few weeks and then it'll be the game you were promised. Ultimately, it's up to you to decide but I would wait a few weeks... even months then check back in.

Magic and the buff that improve magic that heroes have just don't work at all, but oh no ppl are using the only spells that are working well! Got to nerf those, while 90% of magic is trash or broken.
